comments:
Eclipse 3.1 + WTP I20050706

Trying to follow/adapt the tutorial "Building a Simple EJB Application"

New EJBProject
Name it ZooBeansProject
Change EJB Version to 2.0
Choose Generic JBoss 3.2.2 as server
Uncheck Add Module to EAR Application
Check Create and EJB CLient
Check "Add support for annotated Java"
Change Module Name to ZooBeans
Finish

Result: "An Error has occurred when New EJB Project Finished"

This has already been in 07/11 I Build. Please verify in this build. The issue
here is EJB Client creation should not be allowed when creating a standalone ejb
module project

(In reply to comment #1)
> This has already been in 07/11 I Build. Please verify in this build. The issue
> here is EJB Client creation should not be allowed when creating a standalone ejb
> module project

I tried the same thing in 07/13 build. This time, when I unchecked "Add module
to an EAR application", "create an EJB client..." was disabled. I checked "Add
support for annotated Java classes", and got the same error when clicking Finish.

I tried the scenario you mentioned on 07/13 I Build and cannot reproduce it. 
Here are my steps.

1. Create ejb 2.0 project
2. Used Websphere target server
3. Unchecked "Add module to EAR"
4. Checked "Add Annotations support"

Project was created fine with no exceptions thrown

(In reply to comment #3)
> I tried the scenario you mentioned on 07/13 I Build and cannot reproduce it. 
> Here are my steps.
> 
> 1. Create ejb 2.0 project
> 2. Used Websphere target server
> 3. Unchecked "Add module to EAR"
> 4. Checked "Add Annotations support"
> 
> Project was created fine with no exceptions thrown

 I'm using JBoss 3.2.3, but otherwise steps are the same. I'll see what else I
can learn, but perhaps you could also have someone else try before marking
resolved?
Seems I'm not the only one.
